title: Python for Absolute Beginners pt. 1
description:
Note: This is part 1 of 2. You can find part 2 in our course calendar:
https://kubkalender.kb.dk/calendar/datalab

This course is intended for students who have never tried programming before and want to build their skills in Python from the bottom up.

Intimidated by mathematics, numbers, and obscure Python scripts? Don’t be! We will be covering all the very basic concepts and building blocks in order to get complete beginners, who have no experience writing code, working in Python.

This will include explaining the concepts of variables and data types, as well generating some basic scripts to interact with these data, such as lists, loops, and conditionals. By the end of this course, you will have an understanding of the basic building blocks in Python. You will also come away with an appreciation for how a computer program “thinks”. All we require from you is a will to learn. We look forward to seeing you!

The course is divided in two parts. The first covers different datatypes in Python and how data is stored. In other words, it is an introduction to the building blocks of coding in Python.

The second part expands on this by putting these blocks together to create simple scripts. If you already have some understanding of Python, feel free to skip the first section. Otherwise, we recommend that you start with pt. 1 and then move on to pt. 2.

 

Practical information: We will be working in Jupyter Lab / Jupyter Notebook, which requires some installation, but you can also work in either Google Colabs or ERDA which require only a Google or KU account, respectively. For more information and help, consult "Install & Run Python" on the course page:
https://kubdatalab.github.io/python

 

As written, this course is an introduction to the basics of Python. If you have never programmed before, this is a good place to start before you move on to some of our more advanced courses:
https://kubkalender.kb.dk/calendar/datalab

title: Automatiseret transskription med programmet Whisper
description:
Workshoppen er en gennemgang af, hvordan du kommer i gang med at anvende Whisper til at transskribere dine lydfiler, f.eks. interviews. Efterfølgende kan du selv prøve kræfter med programmet, og vi er der til at hjælpe dig i gang. 

Installationen af Whisper ligger på et Ucloud, hvor der er adgang via WAYF, og hvor dine data er i sikkerhed. 

Vi har en lydfil, som vi bruger på kurset, så du behøver ikke at medbringe dine egne data. 

Kursusmaterialet stammer oprindeligt fra AUL-BSS Datalab, som også har skrevet guides, som du kan bruge. Læs mere om materialet på denne side.
campus_name: KUB Nørre Campus, Nørre Allé 49, 2200 København N

The second part expands on this by putting these blocks together to create simple scripts. If you already have some understanding of Python, feel free to skip the first section. Otherwise, we recommend that you start with pt. 1 and then move on to pt. 2.

 

Practical information: We will be working in Jupyter Lab / Jupyter Notebook, which requires some installation, but you can also work in either Google Colabs or ERDA which require only a Google or KU account, respectively. For more information and help, consult "Install & Run Python" on the course page:
https://kubdatalab.github.io/python

 

As written, this course is an introduction to the basics of Python. If you have never programmed before, this is a good place to start before you move on to some of our more advanced courses:
https://kubkalender.kb.dk/calendar/datalab
campus_name: KUB City Campus, Gothersgade 140, 1123 København K
presenter: Benjamin Derksen, Nynne Overlund & Daniel Pryn

title: Python for Absolute Beginners pt. 1
description:
Note: This is part 1 of 2. You can find part 2 in our course calendar:
https://kubkalender.kb.dk/calendar/datalab

This course is intended for students who have never tried programming before and want to build their skills in Python from the bottom up.

Intimidated by mathematics, numbers, and obscure Python scripts? Don’t be! We will be covering all the very basic concepts and building blocks in order to get complete beginners, who have no experience writing code, working in Python.

This will include explaining the concepts of variables and data types, as well generating some basic scripts to interact with these data, such as lists, loops, and conditionals. By the end of this course, you will have an understanding of the basic building blocks in Python. You will also come away with an appreciation for how a computer program “thinks”. All we require from you is a will to learn. We look forward to seeing you!

The second part expands on this by putting these blocks together to create simple scripts. If you already have some understanding of Python, feel free to skip the first section. Otherwise, we recommend that you start with pt. 1 and then move on to pt. 2.

 

Practical information: We will be working in Jupyter Lab / Jupyter Notebook, which requires some installation, but you can also work in either Google Colabs or ERDA which require only a Google or KU account, respectively. For more information and help, consult "Install & Run Python" on the course page:
https://kubdatalab.github.io/python

 

As written, this course is an introduction to the basics of Python. If you have never programmed before, this is a good place to start before you move on to some of our more advanced courses:

title: Text as Data
description:
The course offers an opportunity to gain an understanding of concepts such as  language technology, "text mining" and "distant reading".

In this course, we will look at user-friendly programs. We will use Google Ngram Viewer to understand distant reading and big data. We will use Orange to collect texts from The Guardian and Wikipedia, and we will discuss some common algorithms for text mining on large datasets. With a basis in Voyant and Spyral, we will delve into algorithms and graphs to go in depth with smaller text collections.

Gain knowledge in:

  •   Distant reading with Google Ngram
  •   Data collection and analysis with Orange  
  •   Graphs -  lots of graphs in Voyant Tools and Spyral

The course lasts 2.5 hours with two short breaks and alternates between brief lectures followed by small exercises. The course takes place at KUB Southern Campus in the data lab on the second floor.

The course will be in English if there are participants who do not speak Danish.
campus_name: KUB Søndre Campus, Karen Blixens Plads 7, 2300 Kbh. S

title: NVivo for absolutte begyndere
description:
Introduktion til programmet NVivo, som er en stor hjælp til kvalitativ dataanalyse. NVivo kan bl.a. hjælpe dig med at organisere og kode din empiri og litteratur, generere hypoteser, transskribere din lyd/video og meget andet.

PC-versionen af NVivo har mere udvidet funktionalitet end Mac-versionen, men man kan deltage i alle øvelser uanset version, og undervisningen vil ligeledes blive demonstreret i begge.

 

Du bedes forud for kurset have installeret enten NVivo 14 eller NVivo 15.

Det kan du gøre her til Windows:
NVivo 14:
https://download.qsrinternational.com/Software/NVivo14/NVivo.x64.exe
NVivo 15:
https://download.qsrinternational.com/Software/NVivo15/NVivo.x64.exe

Og her til Mac:
NVivo 14
https://download.qsrinternational.com/Software/NVivo14forMac/NVivo.dmg
NVivo 15:
https://download.qsrinternational.com/Software/NVivo15forMac/NVivo.dmg

Benyt derefter registreringsnøgle fra KU’s Softwarebibliotek. Det er den samme nøgle til både NVivo 14 og 15.

Bemærk: NVivo findes i Sofwarebiblioteket under linket "QSR International - NVivo".

Venligst download og gem de filer, vi skal bruge under kurset. Kig på disse introduktionsøvelser inden kursusstart. Øvelserne dækker det grundlæggende i at importere filer til NVivo samt induktiv/deduktiv kodning og vil hjælpe dig med at sikre, at din NVivo fungerer korrekt. Du kan finde øvelserne og de filer, vi skal bruge i undervisningen HER.
campus_name: KUB Søndre Campus, Karen Blixens Plads 7, 2300 Kbh. S

title: R for Absolute Beginners
description:
R is a general programming language, especially suited for statistical analysis and cleaning and visualization of data.

We assume absolutely no previous experience with programming, and will cover the basics of getting started with R, including:

  • Navigating in RStudio, and how to interact with R
  • Datatypes, variables and objects
  • Simple arithmetic and logical operations on data
  • Working with functions - and how to write a very simple function ourself
  • Import data into R
  • Summary statistics 
  • Manipulating data frames
  • And how to make a couple of the common graphs, that are as useful as they are elementary.

In preparation for the course, we recommend that you either download and install R and RStudio, or register for an account at rstudio.cloud. Instructions on this can be found here, where you will also find the course notes, additional material and exercises.

 

Please note that this course will be held in english if any participants requests it. Otherwise it will be held in danish.
campus_name: KUB Nørre Campus, Nørre Allé 49, 2200 København N

title: Digital Humanities - Text as Data
description:
The course offers an opportunity to gain an understanding of concepts such as  language technology, "text mining" and "distant reading". In this course, we will start with user-friendly programs and websites. We will look at advanced use of Google Ngram Viewer to understand distant reading and big data. We will use Orange to collect texts from The Guardian and Wikipedia, and we will discuss some common algorithms for text mining on large datasets. With a basis in Voyant and Spyral, we will delve into algorithms and graphs to go in depth with smaller text collections.

Gain knowledge in:

  •   Distant reading with Google Ngram
  •   Data collection and analysis with Orange  
  •   Graphs -  lots of graphs in Voyant Tools and Spyral

The course lasts 2.5 hours with two short breaks and alternates between brief lectures followed by small exercises. The course takes place at KUB Southern Campus in the data lab on the second floor.

The course will be in English if there are participants who do not speak Danish.

title: R and APIs - Statistics Denmark
description:
APIs provide access to a multitude of information.

In this course we cover how to extract data though APIs using the Statistics Denmark and i can haz dad joke APIs as examples.

The course material can be found on this website. Please make sure that you have followed the under "Setup" to install R and RStudio as well as some additional packages.

The course requires some previous knowledge of R. We will assume that you are familiar with:

  • Navigating in RStudio, and how to interact with R
  • Datatypes, variables and objects
  • Simple arithmetic and logical operations on data
  • Working with functions - and how to write a very simple function ourself
  • Import data into R
  • Summary statistics 
  • Manipulating data frames

These topics are covered in our introductory courses in R.
campus_name: KUB Nørre Campus, Nørre Allé 49, 2200 København N

title: Introduction to visualizing with ggplot2 in R
description:
Learn more about how you can visualize your data using R and RStudio. We cover the basics of ggplot2, including different types of plots, scales and facetting.

We expect that you have some experience using R, and tidyverse. The level of experience requiered is equivalent to the content of our introductory course in R, "R for absolute beginners".

The course material is published here, and we expect you to have R, RStudio and the tidyverse libraries installed. Instructions for this can be found here.

By default our courses are held in Danish, but if one or more learners request it, we will do it in English.

title: Automatiseret transskription med værktøjet Whisper
description:
Workshoppen er en gennemgang af, hvordan du kommer i gang med at anvende Whisper til at transskribere dine lydfiler, f.eks. interviews. Efterfølgende kan du selv prøve kræfter med programmet, og vi er der til at hjælpe dig i gang. 

Installationen af Whisper ligger på et Ucloud, hvor der er adgang via WAYF, og hvor dine data er i sikkerhed. 

Vi har en lydfil, som vi bruger på kurset, så du behøver ikke at medbringe dine egne data. 

Kursusmaterialet stammer oprindeligt fra AUL-BSS Datalab, som også har skrevet guides, som du kan bruge. Læs mere om materialet på denne side.
campus_name: KUB Søndre Campus, Karen Blixens Plads 7, 2300 Kbh. S

title: Orange - Text and Data Mining for Beginners
description:
We know that programming can be a barrier for many who are fascinated by text and data mining. Therefore, we are hosting a course on the program Orange.

Orange is a user-friendly software for text and data mining, and the great thing about Orange is that you can use it without needing to know how to program. We call this type of program ‘no-code’ software.

The course is recommended if you want to understand how data, such as digital texts and images, can be transformed and analysed by a computer. In this way the course is relevant for both students and researchers who will be using or assessing digital methods and results.  

Orange can handles many of the same tasks and processes that are integrated parts of the concepts of data science that typically is applied to different fields of studies within both natural, social and humanistic science.  

On the course you can learn:  

  •     Data collection of news articles  
  •     Preprocessing before analysis   
  •     Analysis and categorization - both texts and images   
  •     Visualisation

  

The workshop is based on dialog and switches between short talks and practical solving of small tasks.

Before the course, we ask you to download and install the program on your computer. Click here to go to the download page.

title: NVivo for absolutte begyndere
description:
Introduktion til programmet NVivo, som er en stor hjælp til kvalitativ dataanalyse. NVivo kan bl.a. hjælpe dig med at organisere og kode din empiri og litteratur, generere hypoteser, transskribere din lyd/video og meget andet.

PC-versionen af NVivo har mere udvidet funktionalitet end Mac-versionen, men man kan deltage i alle øvelser uanset version, og undervisningen vil ligeledes blive demonstreret i begge.

 

Du bedes forud for kurset have installeret enten NVivo 14 eller NVivo 15.

Det kan du gøre her til Windows:
NVivo 14:
https://download.qsrinternational.com/Software/NVivo14/NVivo.x64.exe
NVivo 15:
https://download.qsrinternational.com/Software/NVivo15/NVivo.x64.exe

Og her til Mac:
NVivo 14
https://download.qsrinternational.com/Software/NVivo14forMac/NVivo.dmg
NVivo 15:
https://download.qsrinternational.com/Software/NVivo15forMac/NVivo.dmg

Benyt derefter registreringsnøgle fra KU’s Softwarebibliotek. Det er den samme nøgle til både NVivo 14 og 15.

Bemærk: NVivo findes i Sofwarebiblioteket under linket "QSR International - NVivo".

Vi anbefaler desuden, at du gennemgår de første tre øvelser beskrevet HER.
campus_name: KUB City Campus, Gothersgade 140, 1123 København K

title: R for Absolute Beginners
description:
R is a general programming language, especially suited for statistical analysis and cleaning and visualization of data.

We assume absolutely no previous experience with programming, and will cover the basics of getting started with R, including:

  • Navigating in RStudio, and how to interact with R
  • Datatypes, variables and objects
  • Simple arithmetic and logical operations on data
  • Working with functions - and how to write a very simple function ourself
  • Import data into R
  • Summary statistics 
  • Manipulating data frames
  • And how to make a couple of the common graphs, that are as useful as they are elementary.

In preparation for the course, we recommend that you either download and install R and RStudio, or register for an account at rstudio.cloud. Instructions on this can be found here, where you will also find the course notes, additional material and exercises.

 

Please note that this course will be held in english if any participants requests it. Otherwise it will be held in danish.
campus_name: KUB Nørre Campus, Nørre Allé 49, 2200 København N

title: NVivo for Absolute Beginners
description:
Introduction to NVivo; a program which is a great help when you are working with qualitative data analysis.

NVivo can be useful, if you want to organise and/or code your empirical material or literature. It can also be helpful when you want to transcribe audio- or video files, generate hypotheses etc.

The PC version of NVivo has more functionality than the Mac version, but you can participate in all exercises with either and we will demonstrate in both.

 

Prior to the course, you must install either NVivo 14 or NVivo 15.

This can be done here for Windows:
NVivo 14:
https://download.qsrinternational.com/Software/NVivo14/NVivo.x64.exe
NVivo 15:
https://download.qsrinternational.com/Software/NVivo15/NVivo.x64.exe

And here for Mac:
NVivo 14
https://download.qsrinternational.com/Software/NVivo14forMac/NVivo.dmg
NVivo 15:
https://download.qsrinternational.com/Software/NVivo15forMac/NVivo.dmg

Registration key is available through the UCPH Software Library. It is the same key for both NVivo 14 and 15.

Please note: NVivo can be found in the Software Library under the link "QSR International - NVivo".

Please download and save the files we will be using during the course. Have a look at these introductory exercises before course start. The exercises cover the basics in importing files into NVivo and inductive/deductive coding and will help you check that your NVivo is running correctly.  Find the exercises and files we will be using in the teaching HERE.

title: NVivo - Cases and Classification in Interview Data
description:
This course is not an introductory course but presupposes a basic understanding of the functionality in NVivo.
This understanding can be gained by participating in our introductory NVivo courses found here:
https://kubkalender.kb.dk/datalab

In this course, we will expand upon the skills gained in our introductory course (https://absalon.ku.dk/courses/71442/), and we will be applying cases and case classification to qualitative data.

We will base the course examples on interview data, but both cases and case classifications can be applied to many other types of data.

The PC version of NVivo has more functionality than the Mac version, but you can participate in all exercises with either and we will demonstrate in both.

 

Prior to the course, you must install either NVivo 14 or NVivo 15.

This can be done here for Windows:
NVivo 14:
https://download.qsrinternational.com/Software/NVivo14/NVivo.x64.exe
NVivo 15:
https://download.qsrinternational.com/Software/NVivo15/NVivo.x64.exe

And here for Mac:
NVivo 14
https://download.qsrinternational.com/Software/NVivo14forMac/NVivo.dmg
NVivo 15:
https://download.qsrinternational.com/Software/NVivo15forMac/NVivo.dmg

Registration key is available through the UCPH Software Library. It is the same key for both NVivo 14 and 15.

Please note: NVivo can be found int the Software Library under the link "QSR International - NVivo".
campus_name: KUB City Campus, Gothersgade 140, 1123 København K
presenter: Benjamin Derksen, Daniel Pryn & Erik Schwägermann

title: R and APIs - Statistics Denmark
description:
APIs provide access to a multitude of information.

In this course we cover how to extract data though APIs using the Statistics Denmark and i can haz dad joke APIs as examples.

The course material can be found on this website. Please make sure that you have followed the under "Setup" to install R and RStudio as well as some additional packages.

The course requires some previous knowledge of R. We will assume that you are familiar with:

  • Navigating in RStudio, and how to interact with R
  • Datatypes, variables and objects
  • Simple arithmetic and logical operations on data
  • Working with functions - and how to write a very simple function ourself
  • Import data into R
  • Summary statistics 
  • Manipulating data frames

These topics are covered in our introductory courses in R.

campus_name: KUB Nørre Campus, Nørre Allé 49, 2200 København N

title: Introduction to visualizing with ggplot2 in R
description:
Learn more about how you can visualize your data using R and RStudio. We cover the basics of ggplot2, including different types of plots, scales and facetting.

We expect that you have some experience using R, and tidyverse. The level of experience requiered is equivalent to the content of our introductory course in R, "R for absolute beginners".

The course material is published here, and we expect you to have R, RStudio and the tidyverse libraries installed. Instructions for this can be found here.

By default our courses are held in Danish, but if one or more learners request it, we will do it in English.

description:

R et grenerelt programmeringssprog, som er særlig egnet til statistiske analyser og til rens og visualisering af data.

Vi forventer ikke, at du har nogen erfaring med programmering. Derfor tager vi udgangspunkt i nogle af R's helt grundlæggende funktionaliterer, som for eksempel:

title: Explorative data analysis with R
description:
How do you gain insight in your data? We explore a largish dataset using statistical methods and visualizations.

We assume that you have some experience working with R, and knows the tidyverse. The level required is what you would learn on one of our introductory course in "R for absolute beginners". 

You should have R and Rstudio installed before the course, and preferably also have downloaded the dataset that we are going to explore. You can find further instructions here.

The course is by default held in Danish - unless one or more participants requests us to do it in English.

title: NVivo for absolutte begyndere
description:
Introduktion til programmet NVivo, som er en stor hjælp til kvalitativ dataanalyse. NVivo kan bl.a. hjælpe dig med at organisere og kode din empiri og litteratur, generere hypoteser, transskribere din lyd/video og meget andet.

PC-versionen af NVivo har mere udvidet funktionalitet end Mac-versionen, men man kan deltage i alle øvelser uanset version, og undervisningen vil ligeledes blive demonstreret i begge.

 

Du bedes forud for kurset have installeret enten NVivo 14 eller NVivo 15.

Det kan du gøre her til Windows:
NVivo 14:
https://download.qsrinternational.com/Software/NVivo14/NVivo.x64.exe
NVivo 15:
https://download.qsrinternational.com/Software/NVivo15/NVivo.x64.exe

Og her til Mac:
NVivo 14
https://download.qsrinternational.com/Software/NVivo14forMac/NVivo.dmg
NVivo 15:
https://download.qsrinternational.com/Software/NVivo15forMac/NVivo.dmg

Benyt derefter registreringsnøgle fra KU’s Softwarebibliotek. Det er den samme nøgle til både NVivo 14 og 15.

Bemærk: NVivo findes i Sofwarebiblioteket under linket "QSR International - NVivo".

Vi anbefaler desuden, at du gennemgår de første tre øvelser beskrevet HER.

title: Åbent værksted i Labbet / drop in consultations at KUB Datalab
description:
Having problems importing data? Or cleaning it? Is the structure weird, or are you getting strange error messages when you try to fit a model?

Drop in with your data and your problem, and we will do our best to help you. We offer no opinions on what statistical test you should run on your data. But we will get it to work. 

No registration required, we try to assist everyone, but if necessary on a "first-come, first-served" basis
campus_name: KUB Nørre Campus, Nørre Allé 49, 2200 København N

title: R for Absolute Beginners
description:
R is a general programming language, especially suited for statistical analysis and cleaning and visualization of data.

We assume absolutely no previous experience with programming, and will cover the basics of getting started with R, including:

  • Navigating in RStudio, and how to interact with R
  • Datatypes, variables and objects
  • Simple arithmetic and logical operations on data
  • Working with functions - and how to write a very simple function ourself
  • Import data into R
  • Summary statistics 
  • Manipulating data frames
  • And how to make a couple of the common graphs, that are as useful as they are elementary.

In preparation for the course, we recommend that you either download and install R and RStudio, or register for an account at rstudio.cloud. Instructions on this can be found here, where you will also find the course notes, additional material and exercises.

 

Please note that this course will be held in english if any participants requests it. Otherwise it will be held in danish.

  • Navigating in RStudio, and how to interact with R
  • Datatypes, variables and objects
  • Simple arithmetic and logical operations on data
  • Working with functions - and how to write a very simple function ourself
  • Import data into R
  • Summary statistics 
  • Manipulating data frames
  • And how to make a couple of the common graphs, that are as useful as they are elementary.

In preparation for the course, we recommend that you either download and install R and RStudio, or register for an account at rstudio.cloud. Instructions on this can be found here, where you will also find the course notes, additional material and exercises.

 

Please note that this course will be held in english if any participants requests it. Otherwise it will be held in danish.
campus_name: KUB Nørre Campus, Nørre Allé 49, 2200 København N

title: NVivo for Absolute Beginners
description:
Introduction to NVivo; a program which is a great help when you are working with qualitative data analysis.

NVivo can be useful, if you want to organise and/or code your empirical material or literature. It can also be helpful when you want to transcribe audio- or video files, generate hypotheses etc.

The PC version of NVivo has more functionality than the Mac version, but you can participate in all exercises with either and we will demonstrate in both.

 

Prior to the course, you must install either NVivo 14 or NVivo 15.

This can be done here for Windows:
NVivo 14:
https://download.qsrinternational.com/Software/NVivo14/NVivo.x64.exe
NVivo 15:
https://download.qsrinternational.com/Software/NVivo15/NVivo.x64.exe

And here for Mac:
NVivo 14
https://download.qsrinternational.com/Software/NVivo14forMac/NVivo.dmg
NVivo 15:
https://download.qsrinternational.com/Software/NVivo15forMac/NVivo.dmg

Registration key is available through the UCPH Software Library. It is the same key for both NVivo 14 and 15.

Please note: NVivo can be found in the Software Library under the link "QSR International - NVivo".

Please download and save the files we will be using during the course. Have a look at these introductory exercises before course start. The exercises cover the basics in importing files into NVivo and inductive/deductive coding and will help you check that your NVivo is running correctly.  Find the exercises and files we will be using in the teaching HERE.

campus_name: KUB Nørre Campus, Nørre Allé 49, 2200 København N

title: Introduction to visualizing with ggplot2 in R
description:
Learn more about how you can visualize your data using R and RStudio. We cover the basics of ggplot2, including different types of plots, scales and facetting.

We expect that you have some experience using R, and tidyverse. The level of experience requiered is equivalent to the content of our introductory course in R, "R for absolute beginners".

The course material is published here, and we expect you to have R, RStudio and the tidyverse libraries installed. Instructions for this can be found here.

By default our courses are held in Danish, but if one or more learners request it, we will do it in English.

title: R for absolutte nybegyndere
description:
Læg venligst mærke til, at kurset holdes på dansk.

Please note that this course will be held in Danish. For courses in English, please visit the datalab course calendar.

 

R et grenerelt programmeringssprog, som er særlig egnet til statistiske analyser og til rens og visualisering af data.

Vi forventer ikke, at du har nogen erfaring med programmering. Derfor tager vi udgangspunkt i nogle af R's helt grundlæggende funktionaliterer, som for eksempel:

  • RStudios grænseflade og hvordan marn interagerer med R
  • Datatyper, variable og objekter
  • Enkle aritmetiske og logiske operationer på data
  • At arbejde med funktioner og hvordan man selv skriver en enkel funktion
  • Import af data i R
  • Opsummerende statistik
  • Bearbejdning af tabeller
  • Simple grafer, som ser lige så brugbare, som de er elementære.

Forud for kurset beder vi dig om at installere R og RStudio eller at oprette en konto på rstudio.cloud. Du kan læse mere om, hvordan man gør, her. Her finder du også kursusmaterialet samt de øvelser, der gennemgåes på kurset.

campus_name: KUB Nørre Campus, Nørre Allé 49, 2200 København N

title: NVivo for absolutte begyndere
description:
Introduktion til programmet NVivo, som er en stor hjælp til kvalitativ dataanalyse. NVivo kan bl.a. hjælpe dig med at organisere og kode din empiri og litteratur, generere hypoteser, transskribere din lyd/video og meget andet.

PC-versionen af NVivo har mere udvidet funktionalitet end Mac-versionen, men man kan deltage i alle øvelser uanset version, og undervisningen vil ligeledes blive demonstreret i begge.

 

Du bedes forud for kurset have installeret enten NVivo 14 eller NVivo 15.

Det kan du gøre her til Windows:
NVivo 14:
https://download.qsrinternational.com/Software/NVivo14/NVivo.x64.exe
NVivo 15:
https://download.qsrinternational.com/Software/NVivo15/NVivo.x64.exe

Og her til Mac:
NVivo 14
https://download.qsrinternational.com/Software/NVivo14forMac/NVivo.dmg
NVivo 15:
https://download.qsrinternational.com/Software/NVivo15forMac/NVivo.dmg

Benyt derefter registreringsnøgle fra KU’s Softwarebibliotek. Det er den samme nøgle til både NVivo 14 og 15.

Bemærk: NVivo findes i Sofwarebiblioteket under linket "QSR International - NVivo".

Vi anbefaler desuden, at du gennemgår de første tre øvelser beskrevet HER.

title: R for Absolute Beginners
description:
R is a general programming language, especially suited for statistical analysis and cleaning and visualization of data.

We assume absolutely no previous experience with programming, and will cover the basics of getting started with R, including:

  • Navigating in RStudio, and how to interact with R
  • Datatypes, variables and objects
  • Simple arithmetic and logical operations on data
  • Working with functions - and how to write a very simple function ourself
  • Import data into R
  • Summary statistics 
  • Manipulating data frames
  • And how to make a couple of the common graphs, that are as useful as they are elementary.

In preparation for the course, we recommend that you either download and install R and RStudio, or register for an account at rstudio.cloud. Instructions on this can be found here, where you will also find the course notes, additional material and exercises.

 

Please note that this course will be held in english if any participants requests it. Otherwise it will be held in danish.

campus_name: KUB Nørre Campus, Nørre Allé 49, 2200 København N

title: R for Absolute Beginners
description:
R is a general programming language, especially suited for statistical analysis and cleaning and visualization of data.

We assume absolutely no previous experience with programming, and will cover the basics of getting started with R, including:

  • Navigating in RStudio, and how to interact with R
  • Datatypes, variables and objects
  • Simple arithmetic and logical operations on data
  • Working with functions - and how to write a very simple function ourself
  • Import data into R
  • Summary statistics 
  • Manipulating data frames
  • And how to make a couple of the common graphs, that are as useful as they are elementary.

In preparation for the course, we recommend that you either download and install R and RStudio, or register for an account at rstudio.cloud. Instructions on this can be found here, where you will also find the course notes, additional material and exercises.

 

Please note that this course will be held in english if any participants requests it. Otherwise it will be held in danish.
campus_name: KUB Nørre Campus, Nørre Allé 49, 2200 København N

title: NVivo for Absolute Beginners
description:
Introduction to NVivo; a program which is a great help when you are working with qualitative data analysis.

NVivo can be useful, if you want to organise and/or code your empirical material or literature. It can also be helpful when you want to transcribe audio- or video files, generate hypotheses etc.

The PC version of NVivo has more functionality than the Mac version, but you can participate in all exercises with either and we will demonstrate in both.

 

Prior to the course, you must install either NVivo 14 or NVivo 15.

This can be done here for Windows:
NVivo 14:
https://download.qsrinternational.com/Software/NVivo14/NVivo.x64.exe
NVivo 15:
https://download.qsrinternational.com/Software/NVivo15/NVivo.x64.exe

And here for Mac:
NVivo 14
https://download.qsrinternational.com/Software/NVivo14forMac/NVivo.dmg
NVivo 15:
https://download.qsrinternational.com/Software/NVivo15forMac/NVivo.dmg

Registration key is available through the UCPH Software Library. It is the same key for both NVivo 14 and 15.

Please note: NVivo can be found in the Software Library under the link "QSR International - NVivo".

Please download and save the files we will be using during the course. Have a look at these introductory exercises before course start. The exercises cover the basics in importing files into NVivo and inductive/deductive coding and will help you check that your NVivo is running correctly.  Find the exercises and files we will be using in the teaching HERE.

title: Automatiseret transskription med værktøjet Whisper
description:
Workshoppen er en gennemgang af, hvordan du kommer i gang med at anvende Whisper til at transskribere dine lydfiler, f.eks. interviews. Efterfølgende kan du selv prøve kræfter med programmet, og vi er der til at hjælpe dig i gang. 

Installationen af Whisper ligger på et Ucloud, hvor der er adgang via WAYF, og hvor dine data er i sikkerhed. 

Vi har en lydfil, som vi bruger på kurset, så du behøver ikke at medbringe dine egne data. 

Kursusmaterialet stammer oprindeligt fra AUL-BSS Datalab, som også har skrevet guides, som du kan bruge. Læs mere om materialet på denne side.
campus_name: KUB Søndre Campus, Karen Blixens Plads 7, 2300 Kbh. S

title: NVivo - Cases and Classification in Interview Data
description:
This course is not an introductory course but presupposes a basic understanding of the functionality in NVivo.
This understanding can be gained by participating in our introductory NVivo courses found here:
https://kubkalender.kb.dk/datalab

In this course, we will expand upon the skills gained in our introductory course (https://absalon.ku.dk/courses/71442/), and we will be applying cases and case classification to qualitative data.

We will base the course examples on interview data, but both cases and case classifications can be applied to many other types of data.

The PC version of NVivo has more functionality than the Mac version, but you can participate in all exercises with either and we will demonstrate in both.

 

Prior to the course, you must install either NVivo 14 or NVivo 15.

This can be done here for Windows:
NVivo 14:
https://download.qsrinternational.com/Software/NVivo14/NVivo.x64.exe

https://download.qsrinternational.com/Software/NVivo15/NVivo.x64.exe

https://download.qsrinternational.com/Software/NVivo15forMac/NVivo.dmg

Registration key is available through the UCPH Software Library. It is the same key for both NVivo 14 and 15.

Please note: NVivo can be found int the Software Library under the link "QSR International - NVivo".

title: R for absolutte nybegyndere
description:
Læg venligst mærke til, at kurset holdes på dansk.

Please note that this course will be held in Danish. For courses in English, please visit the datalab course calendar.

 

R et grenerelt programmeringssprog, som er særlig egnet til statistiske analyser og til rens og visualisering af data.

Vi forventer ikke, at du har nogen erfaring med programmering. Derfor tager vi udgangspunkt i nogle af R's helt grundlæggende funktionaliterer, som for eksempel:

  • RStudios grænseflade og hvordan marn interagerer med R
  • Datatyper, variable og objekter
  • Enkle aritmetiske og logiske operationer på data
  • At arbejde med funktioner og hvordan man selv skriver en enkel funktion
  • Import af data i R
  • Opsummerende statistik
  • Bearbejdning af tabeller
  • Simple grafer, som ser lige så brugbare, som de er elementære.

Forud for kurset beder vi dig om at installere R og RStudio eller at oprette en konto på rstudio.cloud. Du kan læse mere om, hvordan man gør, her. Her finder du også kursusmaterialet samt de øvelser, der gennemgåes på kurset.

title: NVivo for absolutte begyndere
description:
Introduktion til programmet NVivo, som er en stor hjælp til kvalitativ dataanalyse. NVivo kan bl.a. hjælpe dig med at organisere og kode din empiri og litteratur, generere hypoteser, transskribere din lyd/video og meget andet.

PC-versionen af NVivo har mere udvidet funktionalitet end Mac-versionen, men man kan deltage i alle øvelser uanset version, og undervisningen vil ligeledes blive demonstreret i begge.

 

Du bedes forud for kurset have installeret enten NVivo 14 eller NVivo 15.

Det kan du gøre her til Windows:
NVivo 14:
https://download.qsrinternational.com/Software/NVivo14/NVivo.x64.exe
NVivo 15:
https://download.qsrinternational.com/Software/NVivo15/NVivo.x64.exe

Og her til Mac:
NVivo 14
https://download.qsrinternational.com/Software/NVivo14forMac/NVivo.dmg
NVivo 15:
https://download.qsrinternational.com/Software/NVivo15forMac/NVivo.dmg

Benyt derefter registreringsnøgle fra KU’s Softwarebibliotek. Det er den samme nøgle til både NVivo 14 og 15.

Bemærk: NVivo findes i Sofwarebiblioteket under linket "QSR International - NVivo".

Vi anbefaler desuden, at du gennemgår de første tre øvelser beskrevet HER.

title: R for Absolute Beginners
description:
R is a general programming language, especially suited for statistical analysis and cleaning and visualization of data.

We assume absolutely no previous experience with programming, and will cover the basics of getting started with R, including:

  • Navigating in RStudio, and how to interact with R
  • Datatypes, variables and objects
  • Simple arithmetic and logical operations on data
  • Working with functions - and how to write a very simple function ourself
  • Import data into R
  • Summary statistics 
  • Manipulating data frames
  • And how to make a couple of the common graphs, that are as useful as they are elementary.

In preparation for the course, we recommend that you either download and install R and RStudio, or register for an account at rstudio.cloud. Instructions on this can be found here, where you will also find the course notes, additional material and exercises.

 

Please note that this course will be held in english if any participants requests it. Otherwise it will be held in danish.

title: NVivo - Cases and Classification in Interview Data
description:
This course is not an introductory course but presupposes a basic understanding of the functionality in NVivo.
This understanding can be gained by participating in our introductory NVivo courses found here:
https://kubkalender.kb.dk/datalab

In this course, we will expand upon the skills gained in our introductory course (https://absalon.ku.dk/courses/71442/), and we will be applying cases and case classification to qualitative data.

We will base the course examples on interview data, but both cases and case classifications can be applied to many other types of data.

The PC version of NVivo has more functionality than the Mac version, but you can participate in all exercises with either and we will demonstrate in both.

 

Prior to the course, you must install either NVivo 14 or NVivo 15.

This can be done here for Windows:
NVivo 14:
https://download.qsrinternational.com/Software/NVivo14/NVivo.x64.exe
NVivo 15:
https://download.qsrinternational.com/Software/NVivo15/NVivo.x64.exe

And here for Mac:
NVivo 14
https://download.qsrinternational.com/Software/NVivo14forMac/NVivo.dmg
NVivo 15:
https://download.qsrinternational.com/Software/NVivo15forMac/NVivo.dmg

Registration key is available through the UCPH Software Library. It is the same key for both NVivo 14 and 15.

Please note: NVivo can be found int the Software Library under the link "QSR International - NVivo".

title: R and APIs - Statistics Denmark
description:
APIs provide access to a multitude of information.

In this course we cover how to extract data though APIs using the Statistics Denmark and i can haz dad joke APIs as examples.

The course material can be found on this website. Please make sure that you have followed the under "Setup" to install R and RStudio as well as some additional packages.

The course requires some previous knowledge of R. We will assume that you are familiar with:

  • Navigating in RStudio, and how to interact with R
  • Datatypes, variables and objects
  • Simple arithmetic and logical operations on data
  • Working with functions - and how to write a very simple function ourself
  • Import data into R
  • Summary statistics 
  • Manipulating data frames

These topics are covered in our introductory courses in R.

title: Introduction to visualizing with ggplot2 in R
description:
Learn more about how you can visualize your data using R and RStudio. We cover the basics of ggplot2, including different types of plots, scales and facetting.

We expect that you have some experience using R, and tidyverse. The level of experience requiered is equivalent to the content of our introductory course in R, "R for absolute beginners".

The course material is published here, and we expect you to have R, RStudio and the tidyverse libraries installed. Instructions for this can be found here.

By default our courses are held in Danish, but if one or more learners request it, we will do it in English.

title: Explorative data analysis with R
description:
How do you gain insight in your data? We explore a largish dataset using statistical methods and visualizations.

We assume that you have some experience working with R, and knows the tidyverse. The level required is what you would learn on one of our introductory course in "R for absolute beginners". 

You should have R and Rstudio installed before the course, and preferably also have downloaded the dataset that we are going to explore. You can find further instructions here.

The course is by default held in Danish - unless one or more participants requests us to do it in English.

title: R for absolutte nybegyndere
description:
Læg venligst mærke til, at kurset holdes på dansk.

Please note that this course will be held in Danish. For courses in English, please visit the datalab course calendar.

 

R et grenerelt programmeringssprog, som er særlig egnet til statistiske analyser og til rens og visualisering af data.

Vi forventer ikke, at du har nogen erfaring med programmering. Derfor tager vi udgangspunkt i nogle af R's helt grundlæggende funktionaliterer, som for eksempel:

  • RStudios grænseflade og hvordan marn interagerer med R
  • Datatyper, variable og objekter
  • Enkle aritmetiske og logiske operationer på data
  • At arbejde med funktioner og hvordan man selv skriver en enkel funktion
  • Import af data i R
  • Opsummerende statistik
  • Bearbejdning af tabeller
  • Simple grafer, som ser lige så brugbare, som de er elementære.

Forud for kurset beder vi dig om at installere R og RStudio eller at oprette en konto på rstudio.cloud. Du kan læse mere om, hvordan man gør, her. Her finder du også kursusmaterialet samt de øvelser, der gennemgåes på kurset.

title: Introduction to visualizing with ggplot2 in R
description:
Learn more about how you can visualize your data using R and RStudio. We cover the basics of ggplot2, including different types of plots, scales and facetting.

We expect that you have some experience using R, and tidyverse. The level of experience requiered is equivalent to the content of our introductory course in R, "R for absolute beginners".

The course material is published here, and we expect you to have R, RStudio and the tidyverse libraries installed. Instructions for this can be found here.

By default our courses are held in Danish, but if one or more learners request it, we will do it in English.

title: Åbent værksted i Labbet / drop in consultations at KUB Datalab
description:
Having problems importing data? Or cleaning it? Is the structure weird, or are you getting strange error messages when you try to fit a model?

Drop in with your data and your problem, and we will do our best to help you. We offer no opinions on what statistical test you should run on your data. But we will get it to work. 

No registration required, we try to assist everyone, but if necessary on a "first-come, first-served" basis

title: R for Absolute Beginners
description:
R is a general programming language, especially suited for statistical analysis and cleaning and visualization of data.

We assume absolutely no previous experience with programming, and will cover the basics of getting started with R, including:

  • Navigating in RStudio, and how to interact with R
  • Datatypes, variables and objects
  • Simple arithmetic and logical operations on data
  • Working with functions - and how to write a very simple function ourself
  • Import data into R
  • Summary statistics 
  • Manipulating data frames
  • And how to make a couple of the common graphs, that are as useful as they are elementary.

In preparation for the course, we recommend that you either download and install R and RStudio, or register for an account at rstudio.cloud. Instructions on this can be found here, where you will also find the course notes, additional material and exercises.

 

Please note that this course will be held in english if any participants requests it. Otherwise it will be held in danish.

title: R and APIs - Statistics Denmark
description:
APIs provide access to a multitude of information.

In this course we cover how to extract data though APIs using the Statistics Denmark and i can haz dad joke APIs as examples.

The course material can be found on this website. Please make sure that you have followed the under "Setup" to install R and RStudio as well as some additional packages.

The course requires some previous knowledge of R. We will assume that you are familiar with:

  • Navigating in RStudio, and how to interact with R
  • Datatypes, variables and objects
  • Simple arithmetic and logical operations on data
  • Working with functions - and how to write a very simple function ourself
  • Import data into R
  • Summary statistics 
  • Manipulating data frames

These topics are covered in our introductory courses in R.

We assume absolutely no previous experience with programming, and will cover the basics of getting started with R, including:

  • Navigating in RStudio, and how to interact with R
  • Datatypes, variables and objects
  • Simple arithmetic and logical operations on data
  • Working with functions - and how to write a very simple function ourself
  • Import data into R
  • Summary statistics 
  • Manipulating data frames
  • And how to make a couple of the common graphs, that are as useful as they are elementary.

In preparation for the course, we recommend that you either download and install R and RStudio, or register for an account at rstudio.cloud. Instructions on this can be found here, where you will also find the course notes, additional material and exercises.

 

Please note that this course will be held in english if any participants requests it. Otherwise it will be held in danish.
campus_name: KUB Nørre Campus, Nørre Allé 49, 2200 København N

title: Automatiseret transskription med værktøjet Whisper
description:
Workshoppen er en gennemgang af, hvordan du kommer i gang med at anvende Whisper til at transskribere dine interviews. Efterfølgende kan du selv prøve kræfter med programmet, og vi er der til at hjælpe dig i gang.

Installationen af Whisper ligger på et Ucloud, hvor der er adgang via WAYF, og hvor dine data er i sikkerhed.

Vi har en lydfil, så du behøver ikke at medbringe dine egne data.

Kursusmaterialet stammer fra AUL-BSS Datalab.

Læs mere om materialet på denne side.
campus_name: KUB Frederiksberg, Dyrlægevej 10, 1870 Frederiksberg C

title: NVivo for Absolute Beginners
description:
Introduction to NVivo; a program which is a great help when you are working with qualitative data analysis.

NVivo can be useful, if you want to organise and/or code your empirical material or literature. It can also be helpful when you want to transcribe audio- or video files, generate hypotheses etc.

The PC version of NVivo has more functionality than the Mac version, but you can participate in all exercises with either and we will demonstrate in both.

 

Prior to the course, you must install either NVivo 14 or NVivo 15.

This can be done here for Windows:
NVivo 14:
https://download.qsrinternational.com/Software/NVivo14/NVivo.x64.exe
NVivo 15:
https://download.qsrinternational.com/Software/NVivo15/NVivo.x64.exe

And here for Mac:
NVivo 14
https://download.qsrinternational.com/Software/NVivo14forMac/NVivo.dmg
NVivo 15:
https://download.qsrinternational.com/Software/NVivo15forMac/NVivo.dmg

Registration key is available through the UCPH Software Library. It is the same key for both NVivo 14 and 15.

Please note: NVivo can be found int the Software Library under the link "QSR International - NVivo".

We also recommend that you complete a set of introductory exercises before course start, that you can read about HERE.
campus_name: KUB Nørre Campus, Nørre Allé 49, 2200 København N

title: Introduction to visualizing with ggplot2 in R
description:
Learn more about how you can visualize your data using R and RStudio. We cover the basics of ggplot2, including different types of plots, scales and facetting.

We expect that you have some experience using R, and tidyverse. The level of experience requiered is equivalent to the content of our introductory course in R, "R for absolute beginners".

The course material is published here, and we expect you to have R, RStudio and the tidyverse libraries installed. Instructions for this can be found here.

By default our courses are held in Danish, but if one or more learners request it, we will do it in English.
campus_name: KUB Nørre Campus, Nørre Allé 49, 2200 København N

title: NVivo for absolutte begyndere
description:
Introduktion til programmet NVivo, som er en stor hjælp til kvalitativ dataanalyse. NVivo kan bl.a. hjælpe dig med at organisere og kode din empiri og litteratur, generere hypoteser, transskribere din lyd/video og meget andet.

PC-versionen af NVivo har mere udvidet funktionalitet end Mac-versionen, men man kan deltage i alle øvelser uanset version, og undervisningen vil ligeledes blive demonstreret i begge.

 

Du bedes forud for kurset have installeret enten NVivo 14 eller NVivo 15.

Det kan du gøre her til Windows:
NVivo 14:
https://download.qsrinternational.com/Software/NVivo14/NVivo.x64.exe
NVivo 15:
https://download.qsrinternational.com/Software/NVivo15/NVivo.x64.exe

Og her til Mac:
NVivo 14
https://download.qsrinternational.com/Software/NVivo14forMac/NVivo.dmg
NVivo 15:
https://download.qsrinternational.com/Software/NVivo15forMac/NVivo.dmg

Benyt derefter registreringsnøgle fra KU’s Softwarebibliotek. Det er den samme nøgle til både NVivo 14 og 15.

Bemærk: NVivo findes i Sofwarebiblioteket under linket "QSR International - NVivo".

Vi anbefaler desuden, at du gennemgår de første tre øvelser beskrevet HER.
campus_name: KUB City Campus, Gothersgade 140, 1123 København K

title: Explorative data analysis with R
description:
How do you gain insight in your data? We explore a largish dataset using statistical methods and visualizations.

We assume that you have some experience working with R, and knows the tidyverse. The level required is what you would learn on one of our introductory course in "R for absolute beginners". 

You should have R and Rstudio installed before the course, and preferably also have downloaded the dataset that we are going to explore. You can find further instructions here.

The course is by default held in Danish - unless one or more participants requests us to do it in English.

title: R for Absolute Beginners - ONLINE
description:
R is a general programming language, especially suited for statistical analysis and cleaning and visualization of data.

We assume absolutely no previous experience with programming, and will cover the basics of getting started with R, including:

  • Navigating in RStudio, and how to interact with R
  • Datatypes, variables and objects
  • Simple arithmetic and logical operations on data
  • Working with functions - and how to write a very simple function ourself
  • Import data into R
  • Summary statistics 
  • Manipulating data frames
  • And how to make a couple of the common graphs, that are as useful as they are elementary.

In preparation for the course, we recommend that you either download and install R and RStudio, or register for an account at rstudio.cloud. Instructions on this can be found here, where you will also find the course notes, additional material and exercises.

 

Please note that this course will be held in english if any participants requests it. Otherwise it will be held in danish.
campus_name: NA

title: NVivo for absolutte begyndere
description:
Introduktion til programmet NVivo, som er en stor hjælp til kvalitativ dataanalyse. NVivo kan bl.a. hjælpe dig med at organisere og kode din empiri og litteratur, generere hypoteser, transskribere din lyd/video og meget andet.

PC-versionen af NVivo har mere udvidet funktionalitet end Mac-versionen, men man kan deltage i alle øvelser uanset version, og undervisningen vil ligeledes blive demonstreret i begge.

 

Du bedes forud for kurset have installeret enten NVivo 14 eller NVivo 15.

Det kan du gøre her til Windows:
NVivo 14:
https://download.qsrinternational.com/Software/NVivo14/NVivo.x64.exe
NVivo 15:
https://download.qsrinternational.com/Software/NVivo15/NVivo.x64.exe

Og her til Mac:
NVivo 14
https://download.qsrinternational.com/Software/NVivo14forMac/NVivo.dmg
NVivo 15:
https://download.qsrinternational.com/Software/NVivo15forMac/NVivo.dmg

Benyt derefter registreringsnøgle fra KU’s Softwarebibliotek. Det er den samme nøgle til både NVivo 14 og 15.

Bemærk: NVivo findes i Sofwarebiblioteket under linket "QSR International - NVivo".

Vi anbefaler desuden, at du gennemgår de første tre øvelser beskrevet HER.
campus_name: KUB City Campus, Gothersgade 140, 1123 København K

title: Introduction to visualizing with ggplot2 in R
description:
Learn more about how you can visualize your data using R and RStudio. We cover the basics of ggplot2, including different types of plots, scales and facetting.

We expect that you have some experience using R, and tidyverse. The level of experience requiered is equivalent to the content of our introductory course in R, "R for absolute beginners".

The course material is published here, and we expect you to have R, RStudio and the tidyverse libraries installed. Instructions for this can be found here.

By default our courses are held in Danish, but if one or more learners request it, we will do it in English.
campus_name: KUB Nørre Campus, Nørre Allé 49, 2200 København N
